page.title: 09Arlington Village.
page.content: A settlement which was well established in Saxon times, later becoming the most important village in the area, is today struggling to survive. It comprises a Saxon Church, a public house and a close cluster of 13 well-kept houses, occupied by country-loving people who choose to retire there, or are prepared to commute as far as 50 miles to work. There is very little employment in the immediate, mainly agricultural, area. There are some 30 other dwellings within a 2 miles radius of the Church. The greatest fear is that the houses might be acquired by "weekenders". Current disturbance comes from traffic speeding home from nearby Speedway Stadium weekly meetings, using track techniques on winding narrow lanes.
